text: You have created an unitialized session,

text: please use the "ssh_session ssh_new()" function to fully intialize a new session.

text: It returns a new ssh_session pointer, or NULL on error.

speaker: Programmer
text: how to connect to localhost?

speaker: Apiza
text: You can connect to a session by using the "int ssh_connect(ssh_session session)" function.

speaker: Programmer
text: where to give username and password?

speaker: Programmer
text: how to authenticate the server?

speaker: Apiza
text: You can set properties of a session using the "ssh_options_set(session, option, char*)" function.

speaker: Apiza
text: An example would be to set the host options,

speaker: Apiza
text: which can be done with the following statement "ssh_options_set(my_ssh_session, SSH_OPTIONS_HOST, "129.0.0.1");"

speaker: Apiza
text: There are several functions to authenticate a session,

speaker: Apiza
text: would you like me to enumerate them all?

speaker: Programmer
text: tell me the easiest one

speaker: Apiza
text: "int ssh_userauth_publickey_auto(ssh_session session, const char* username, const char* passphrase)" will attempt to automatically authenticate with public key and "none".

speaker: Apiza
text: Would you like me to list the parameters?

speaker: Programmer
text: howt to "Disconnect from the server and free the session." ?

speaker: Apiza
text: "ssh_disconnect(ssh_session session)" and "ssh_free(ssh_session session)" functions can be used to clean up resources.

speaker: Programmer
text: how to Create and open a new ssh_channel in the ssh_session ?

speaker: Apiza
text: "ssh_channel ssh_channel_new(ssh_session session)" function can be used to create a new channel from a session.

speaker: Apiza
text: There are a few functions that can open a ssh_channel depending upon settings such as protocol, purpose, etc.

speaker: Apiza
text: Would you like me to list them all?

speaker: Programmer
text: tell the easiest one

speaker: Apiza
text: "int ssh_channel_open_session(ssh_channel channel)" seems to be the function that opens a channel that has the least amount of configuration.

speaker: Programmer
text: how to Execute the command "who" on the open channel?

speaker: Apiza
text: The function "int ssh_channel_request_exec(ssh_channel channel, const char* cmd)" executes a shell command without an interactive shell on the host machine.

speaker: Programmer
text: how to read response from channel?

speaker: Apiza
text: You can read data from a channel using the "int ssh_channel_read(ssh_channel channel, void* buff, uint32_t count, int is_stderr)" function.

speaker: Programmer
text: what are these ? ```void* buff, uint32_t count, int is_stderr```

speaker: Apiza
text: According to the API documentation, void* buff is a destination buffer where the read data will be transferred to. unit32_t count is the number of bytes to be read, and int is_stderr is a boolean value to mark reading from the stderr flow.

speaker: Programmer
text: what values should i give ?

speaker: Apiza
text: I am sorry,

speaker: Apiza
text: I am confused.

speaker: Programmer
text: can you give me example use of ssh_channel_read?

speaker: Apiza
text: An example usage of ssh_channel_read would be "ssh_channel_read(my_channel, my_buffer, sizeof(buffer), 0);" to read 512 bytes from the channel stdout if my_buffer is an array of type "char" of size 512.

speaker: Apiza
text: Excuse me, "sizeof(buffer)" should be "sizeof(my_buffer)" in the above example.

speaker: Programmer
text: can you give me an example of my_buffer or buffer?

speaker: Apiza
text: A statically allocated buffer would use the following command "char my_buffer[512];"

speaker: Programmer
text: how to shutdown the channel ?

speaker: Apiza
text: There are two functions that refer to the functionality you are requestion.

speaker: Apiza
text: The first is "int ssh_channel_close(ssh_channel channel)" and the second is "void ssh_channel_free(ssh_channel channel)."

speaker: Programmer
text: how to send eof?

speaker: Apiza
text: You can use the function "int ssh_channel_send_eof(ssh_channel channel)" to send an end of file on the channel.

speaker: Programmer
text: how to Create and initialize a new sftp session on the connected ssh session ?

speaker: Apiza
text: You can use the "ssftp_session sftp_new(ssh_session session)" to start a new sftp session.

speaker: Apiza
text: Excuse me "sftp_session sftp_new(ssh_session session)"

speaker: Programmer
text: how to Create a new file in Dir1?

speaker: Apiza
text: To open a new file using sftp, you can use the "sftp_file sftp_open(sftp_session session, const char* filepath, int accesstype, mode_t mode)" function.

speaker: Programmer
text: can you give me an example of mode?

speaker: Apiza
text: An example mode_t mode value would be "S_IRWXU".

speaker: Programmer
text: how to create a new directory?

speaker: Apiza
text: You can create a new directory using the "int sftp_mkdir(sftp_session session, const char* dirpath, mode_t mode)" function.

speaker: Programmer
text: can you give me an example of accesstype?

speaker: Apiza
text: An example of an access type would be "int access_type = O_WRONLY | O_CREAT | O_TRUNC;"

speaker: Programmer
text: how to write a string to the file ?

speaker: Apiza
text: You can write to an open file using the "ssize_t sftp_write(sftp_file file, const void* buffer, size_t count)" function.

speaker: Programmer
text: can you give me an example of const void* buffer ?

speaker: Apiza
text: In this specific case, "const void* buffer" is the contents of the file to be written.

speaker: Apiza
text: An example would to write a static message "hello world!" where const char* buff = "hello world!";.

speaker: Programmer
text: an example of count ?

speaker: Apiza
text: "count" is the number of bytes to be written to the file.

speaker: Apiza
text: In the example where the buffer is "hello world!", count would be sizeof(buffer).

speaker: Programmer
text: how to close the file?

speaker: Apiza
text: You can close a file using the "int sftp_close(sftp_file file)" function.

speaker: Programmer
text: how to free the session?

speaker: Apiza
text: To free a sftp_session, use the "void sftp_free(sftp_session session)" function.

text: You can use the "int sftp_get_error(sftp_session session)" function to get the latest error set by a posix like sftp function.

speaker: Apiza
text: an example for error checking when creating a directory is "if (sftp_get_error(session) != SSH_FX_FILE_ALREADY_EXISTS) { ... }"

speaker: Apiza
